hero.headline: Go With Gayler
paragraphs: Richard Gayler is running for Idaho State Senate to bring fresh, principled leadership to District 12. With over 30 years of experience in public service and community organization, Richard understands the challenges facing working families.
From affordable healthcare to quality education, Richard is committed to fighting for policies that create opportunity for everyone, not just the wealthy and well-connected.

Richard believes government works best when it listens first. He’s focused on practical, bipartisan solutions, fiscal responsibility, and restoring trust by putting people ahead of politics. Above all, Richard is committed to serving District 6 with integrity, transparency, and a deep respect for the communities he represents.

quotes.quote: Richard Gayler has been a tireless advocate for working families. Her dedication to economic justice and educational equity makes her the clear choice for State Senate.

issues.title: Investing in Public Education
issues.blurb: Our children deserve world-class schools with well-paid teachers, modern facilities, and resources to succeed.
issues.body:
Public education is the foundation of opportunity and economic mobility. Yet our per pupil funding support is an embarrassing last in the nation. The message that our state legislators are sending us is that they don't believe in our school system, our individual schools, our teachers and our students. This must change! In District 6, schools are our link to community bonding. We have 11 high schools in the region, and we cannot afford to let your state representatives continue to erode and ignore our public school system.

Richard Gayler will fight for increased education funding, higher teacher salaries, and modern school facilities. He supports affordable college tuition and expanded vocational training programs. Every child in District 6 deserves access to excellent public schools. Richard will prioritize education funding and ensure our tax dollars support students, not private or religious school vouchers.

issues.title: Affordable Healthcare for All
issues.blurb: Everyone deserves access to quality, affordable healthcare. Richard will fight to expand coverage and lower drug costs.
issues.body:
Healthcare is a human right, not a privilege. Too many families in District 6 are struggling with rising insurance premiums, high deductibles, and skyrocketing prescription drug costs.

Richard Gayler believes we must expand access to affordable healthcare by supporting policies to expand healthcare services, improve access to mental health and substance abuse services and Medicaid. He will work to protect coverage for pre-existing conditions and ensure rural communities have access to quality care.

As your State Senator, Richard will also fight to enact the reproductive freedom act and put the decision of health care between the individual and their healthcare provider. Not the legislators.

issues.title: Voter Initiative Two-Term Limit for Public Office
issues.blurb: We need politicians focused on the people they represent, not their political careers.
issues.body: We need politicians to be more focused on the people they are to represent as opposed to their own political career. I urge you to vote against any candidate who has been in office for longer than two terms. Let's take back control of how we are governed as greed, ego and money have gotten in the way to improve the lives of Idahoans.

updates.title: Richard Gayler Announces Campaign for State Senate
updates.excerpt: Local organizer and community leader Richard Gayler officially launched her campaign for State Senate District 12, promising to fight for working families and bring fresh leadership to the capitol.
updates.body:
SPRINGFIELD – Richard Gayler today officially announced her candidacy for State Senate District 12, joining the race to bring principled, people-first leadership to the state capitol.

"For too long, our district has been represented by politicians who put special interests ahead of working families," Gayler said at a campaign kickoff event attended by over 200 supporters. "I'm running to change that."

Gayler, who has spent 15 years organizing in communities across the district, outlined an ambitious agenda focused on affordable healthcare, quality public education, and economic opportunity.

"This campaign is about building a future where everyone has a fair shot—not just the wealthy and well-connected," Gayler said. "It's about showing up, listening, and fighting for what matters most to the people of District 12."

The campaign has already earned endorsements from local teachers, small business owners, and community leaders.

updates.title: Gayler Unveils Comprehensive Healthcare Plan
updates.excerpt: Richard Gayler released a detailed plan to expand healthcare access and lower costs for families in District 12, including prescription drug price caps and expanded coverage options.
updates.body:
Richard Gayler today released her comprehensive healthcare plan, outlining specific steps to expand access and lower costs for families across District 12.

The plan includes:
- Supporting a state public option for health insurance
- Capping out-of-pocket costs for families
- Allowing bulk purchasing of prescription drugs to lower prices
- Protecting coverage for pre-existing conditions
- Expanding rural healthcare access

"No family should have to choose between paying for medicine and putting food on the table," Gayler said. "Healthcare is a human right, and it's time our state treated it that way."

The plan has earned praise from healthcare advocates, patients' rights groups, and medical professionals across the district.

"Richard's plan is exactly what we need—practical solutions that will make a real difference for working families," said Dr. Rachel Thompson, a family physician in Springfield.

updates.title: Teachers Union Endorses Gayler Campaign
updates.excerpt: Teachers Union Local 42 announced its endorsement of Richard Gayler, citing her commitment to public education and support for educators.
updates.body:
Teachers Union Local 42 today announced its endorsement of Richard Gayler for State Senate, praising her commitment to public education and track record of supporting teachers and students.

"Richard Gayler has always stood with educators and students," said Maria Rodriguez, union president. "She understands that investing in public education is investing in our future, and we're proud to endorse her campaign."

The endorsement comes as Gayler has made education funding a centerpiece of her campaign, calling for increased teacher pay, smaller class sizes, and modern school facilities.

"Teachers are the backbone of our community," Gayler said. "They deserve our support, fair pay, and the resources they need to help every student succeed. As your State Senator, that's exactly what they'll get."

The union represents over 2,000 educators across District 12.
